docs.lead_paragraph: This 30-second commercial, titled ''Congress,'' was released yesterday by Jon S. Corzine, the Democratic candidate for United States Senate from New Jersey. It is being broadcast on television stations in New York and Philadelphia. PRODUCER -- Shrum, Devine & Donilon.
docs.abstract: Analysis in series (The Ad Campaign) examines 30-second television commercial released by Jon S Corzine, Democratic candidate for US Senate from NJ; ad presents Corzine's opponent, Repr Bob Franks, in unflattering light; photo (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re ''More Patients in Hospice Care, but for Far Fewer Final Days'' (news article, Sept. 18): The real problem is not that people and doctors are avoiding hospice care but rather that it so difficult to get appropriate services for people with terminal illnesses, chronic conditions and severe disabilities.
docs.abstract: Nancy Guilfoy Valko letter says problem with hospice care is difficulty of getting appropriate services for people with terminal illnesses (S)
docs.snippet: To the Editor:    Re ''More Patients in Hospice Care, but for Far Fewer Final Days'' (news article, Sept. 18):    The real problem is not that people and doctors are avoiding hospice care but rather that it so difficult to get appropriate services...

docs.lead_paragraph: The suicide of the new president of Nippon Credit Bank, which was saved from insolvency earlier this month by a group of investors led by the Softbank Corporation, has stunned Japan's banking industry. And it has underscored the human misery caused by the burden of bad debt that continues to vex the Japanese financial system. Tadayo Honma, a former senior official of the nation's central bank who joined the investor group in February, apparently hanged himself from a curtain rod in a hotel while on a business trip to western Japan. His body was found early Wednesday by his secretary.

headline.main: In Japan Banker's Suicide, Hints of Debt Burden's Human Toll

docs.abstract: Suicide of Tadayo Honma, new president of Nippon Credit Bank, which was saved from insolvency by group of investors led by Softbank Corp, has stunned Japan's banking industry; it has underscored human misery caused by burden of bad debt that continues to vex Japanese financial system; Nippon Credit says managing director, Yoshinobu Kodera, will be acting president until replacement for Honma is found (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re ''Frustration Grows With Cost of Health Insurance'' (front page, Sept. 18): The inability of the United States, the richest country on earth, to provide health insurance to all its inhabitants is, to the foreign eye, most puzzling. The first reaction of any European or Canadian is inevitably: Why in the world do you keep such an unfair and inefficient system? Why can't Congress simply extend Medicare to everyone?
docs.abstract: Jean-Francois Briere letter wonders at inability of richest country on eath to provide health insurance to all its inhabitants (S)
